what: Use the following line to include the chemboxR package in your development:
title: chemboxR
chemboxR
text: get_elements function strip molecule base elements along count element within molecule create dataframe. order , call function pass molecule string : can also call multiples one element :
code: get_elements("C2H4") #>   element count #> 1       C     2 #> 2       H     4 get_elements("(C2H4)5") #>   element count #> 1       C    10 #> 2       H    20 get_elements('Al2(SO4)3') #>   element count #> 1      Al     2 #> 2       S     3 #> 3       O    12 get_elements('LiH2') #>   element count #> 1      Li     1 #> 2       H     2

title: chemboxR
text: function check molecule chemically viable output Boolean response True False. use function, call pass molecule string:
code: # Calcium carbonate (a common salt) is_valid('Al2(SO4)3') #> [1] TRUE # Sodium hydroxide (a common base) is_valid('NaOH') #> [1] TRUE # Carbonic acid (a common acid) is_valid('H2CO3') #> [1] TRUE

title: chemboxR
text: function output dataframe properties element molecule contains. use function call pass molecule string:
code: get_molec_props('NaOH') #>   Symbol  Element AtomicNumber AtomicMass   Density AtomicRadius       Config #> 1      H Hydrogen            1    1.00800 8.988e-05           53          1s1 #> 2      O   Oxygen            8   15.99900 1.429e-03           48 [He] 2s2 2p4 #> 3     Na   Sodium           11   22.98977 9.710e-01          190     [Ne] 3s1 #>   ShellConfig OxiStates #> 1     1,,,,,,         1 #> 2    2,6,,,,,        -2 #> 3   2,8,1,,,,         1 get_molec_props('CaCl3') #>   Symbol  Element AtomicNumber AtomicMass  Density AtomicRadius       Config #> 1     Ca  Calcium           20     40.078 1.540000          194     [Ar] 4s2 #> 2     Cl Chlorine           17     35.450 0.003214           79 [Ne] 3s2 3p5 #>   ShellConfig  OxiStates #> 1  2,8,8,2,,,          2 #> 2   2,8,7,,,, -1,1,3,5,7 get_molec_props('Al2(SO4)3(C2H4)5') #>   Symbol   Element AtomicNumber AtomicMass   Density AtomicRadius       Config #> 1     Al Aluminium           13   26.98154 2.698e+00          118 [Ne] 3s2 3p1 #> 2      C    Carbon            6   12.01100 2.267e+00           67 [He] 2s2 2p2 #> 3      H  Hydrogen            1    1.00800 8.988e-05           53          1s1 #> 4      O    Oxygen            8   15.99900 1.429e-03           48 [He] 2s2 2p4 #> 5      S    Sulfur           16   32.06000 2.067e+00           88 [Ne] 3s2 3p4 #>   ShellConfig             OxiStates #> 1   2,8,3,,,,                     3 #> 2    2,4,,,,, -4,-3,-2,-1,0,1,2,3,4 #> 3     1,,,,,,                     1 #> 4    2,6,,,,,                    -2 #> 5   2,8,6,,,,              -2,2,4,6

title: chemboxR
text: function output molecules result combustion specified molecule dataframe. use function, call pass molecule string:
code: get_combustion_equation('C2H4') #>   C2H4 O2 CO2 H2O #> 1    1  3   2   2 get_combustion_equation('C4H6') #>   C4H6 O2 CO2 H2O #> 1    2 11   8   6 get_combustion_equation('C5H12') #>   C5H12 O2 CO2 H2O #> 1     1  8   5   6

title: Contributing to chemboxR
text: Report bugs https://github.com/UBC-MDS/chemboxR/issues reporting bug, please include: operating system name version. details local setup might helpful troubleshooting. Detailed steps reproduce bug.

text: can never enough documentation! Please feel free contribute part documentation, official docs, docstrings, even web blog posts, articles, .

title: Contributing to chemboxR
text: best way send feedback file issue https://github.com/UBC-MDS/chembox/issues proposing feature: Explain detail work. Keep scope narrow possible, make easier implement. Remember volunteer-driven project, contributions welcome :)

title: Contributing to chemboxR
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to chemboxR
text: Fork chemboxr repo GitHub. Clone fork locally: Open folder RStudio. Load devtools install package: Use git create branch local development make changes: ’re done making changes, check changes conform code formatting requirements pass tests. Commit changes open pull request.
code: $ git clone git@github.com:your_name_here/chembox.git > library(devtools) > install() $ git switch -c name-of-your-bugfix-or-feature > check() $ git add . $ git commit -m "Your detailed description of your changes." $ git push origin name-of-your-bugfix-or-feature

title: Contributing to chemboxR
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to chemboxR
text: submit pull request, check meets guidelines: pull request include additional tests appropriate. pull request adds functionality, docs updated, including adding description new function README.md. pull request work currently supported operating systems versions R. Check https://github.com/UBC-MDS/chemboxr/pulls make sure tests pass supported R versions.

title: Contributing to chemboxR
text: Please note chemboxR project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: ChemboxR is an R copy of Chembox, originally written in python
text: chemboxR package molecular information calculator based empirical formulas chemicals raw text. designed intelligently process text input containing chemical formula provide associated information inquired molecule. able provide molar mass, check formula’s validity, provide balanced combustion equation input combustible. tool can utilized various educational research purposes simple fast information retrieval.

title: ChemboxR is an R copy of Chembox, originally written in python
text: can install development version chemboxR GitHub :

title: ChemboxR is an R copy of Chembox, originally written in python
text: package includes 4 functions solving chemistry problems: get_elementsa parser takes chemical formula string format returns dictionary contains elements respective count. is_valid: checker returns boolean indicating whether given input chemically reasonable. get_molec_props: method takes chemical formula string format returns dataframe various useful properties element formula. get_combustion_equation: method takes text chemical formula contains carbon (C) hydrogen (H) outputs balanced equation resulting combustion.

title: ChemboxR is an R copy of Chembox, originally written in python
text: order able perform functions , dataset need used contains various atomic properties elements periodic table. data can found Chembox repo sourced . Please note take credit dataset, merely use functions.

title: ChemboxR is an R copy of Chembox, originally written in python
text: similar package chemr available online employs similar string-parsing design molar mass calculation. Additionally, string-parsing chemical reactions implemented. differently: support validity checks unambiguous acids, bases salts. include methods specifically automated combustion equation generation balancing.
